result.execSummary:
The defendant William M. Gates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Schedule IV Drugs, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(i).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions: 

Must complete all assessments and follow through with all recommendations of agent.

Pay all costs including DNA surcharge. 
 
Complete job skill assessment and obtain at least part-time employment with consideration to medical conditions if any.

No contact with anyone under age 18 without permission of agent.

Comply with all sex offender reporting requirements.

Not to reside with any other parties who use drugs or alcohol.

Follow all rules and regulations of probation. 

Parties stipulate to 0 days credit in the event of revocation.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: On 10/4/17, Court, in accordance with Def and DOC's request, ordered probation revoked. Court sentences Def now to "costs only." DOC has noted that Def recently paid all costs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William M. Gates

defendant.name: Gates, William M.
defendant.address: 667 S. Ira St., Richland Center, WI 53581

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Probation Agent Mary Collins-Johnsrud in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant William M. Gates in court without counsel. Today's hearing was set at request of the agent; per ADA Forehand, Def has asked to revoke probation and receive a time served sentence; Forehand states def has completed 75 percent of his probation and done relatively well on probation; def now has a chance to reside with family member in WI Dells and wouldn't be allowed that transfer without a change in probation status. Def states he wants to revoke probation. Court orders probation revoked. Agent notes this probation was on a withheld sentence; notes def has fulfilled his financial obligations with recent payment (not yet processed to the court through cashier's unit). Court sentences def to "costs only." Probation now complete.
def requesting a court review to vacate probation (forwarded to judge for review, paper)
Probation review hearing on October 4, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for William M. Gates
Current: 667 S. Ira St., Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 09-26-2017)
Prior: 667 S. Ira Street, Richland Center, WI 53581
Agent's request for probation review hearing

Defendant William M. Gates in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Argument by DA Harper, requests 3 years probation with condition: 12 months conditional jail time and all other recommendations made by agent in PSI. Atty Longacre argument-requests 9 months straight jail time, to be served outside of Richland County with a 60 day stay. Comment by def.

Sentencing: Sentence withheld for 3 years probation. As conditions: Must complete all assessments and follow through with all recommendations of agent, pay all costs, complete job skill assessment and obtain at least part-time employment with consideration to medical conditions if any, no contact with anyone under age 18 without permission of agent, comply with all sex offender reporting requirements, not to reside with any other parties who use drugs or alcohol, follow all rules and regulations of probation. Pay DNA surcharge, though sampling is not needed. Parties stipulate to 0 days credit in the event of revocation.

Defendant William M. Gates in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Today was to be sentencing but DA states time is needed on the calendar for an argued sentence; PSI has been received.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

per phone call from Atty. Longacre, def is in a health facility and will be unable to attend the sent. hrg set for March 18th; Atty. L requests adjournment of 30 days; DA does not object to this request but requests that Atty. L provide proof of def's status as a patient; clerk resets this matter to April 22 at 9
JL of JA's office informs COC that March 4th sentencing has been changed to March 18th

Defendant William M. Gates in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Formal reading waived.  Rights stated including prelim rights.  Def waives right to prelim.  Court's colloquy re rights waiver.  Atty. L has advised the Court that the parties have an agreement to resolve this matter; plea waiver presented.  Def pleads no contest.  Court's colloquy re plea.  Finding of guilty.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for March 4 at 9.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant William M. Gates appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre in court for Defendant William M. Gates.  DA states she's provided counsel with a copy of the complaint.  Atty. L waives formal reading; states he hasn't had a chance to talk with his client about these charges yet.  Court states max. penalties as stated on the complaint.  Atty. L asks for adjournment of this initial.  This matter adjourned to Jan. 7 at 2:30.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
